title: Google\Cloud\Batch\V1\Volume
name: Volume
description:
Volume describes a volume and parameters for it to be mounted to a VM.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.batch.v1.Volume

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.nfs
params.description: A Network File System (NFS) volume. For example, a Filestore file share.

params.name: data.device_name
params.description: Device name of an attached disk volume, which should align with a device_name specified by job.allocation_policy.instances[0].policy.disks[i].device_name or defined by the given instance template in job.allocation_policy.instances[0].instance_template.

params.name: data.mount_path
params.description: The mount path for the volume, e.g. /mnt/disks/share.

params.name: data.mount_options
params.description: For Google Cloud Storage (GCS), mount options are the options supported by the gcsfuse tool (https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/gcsfuse). For existing persistent disks, mount options provided by the mount command (https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man8/mount.8.html) except writing are supported. This is due to restrictions of multi-writer mode (https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/sharing-disks-between-vms). For other attached disks and Network File System (NFS), mount options are these supported by the mount command (https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man8/mount.8.html).

methods.name: getMountOptions
methods.description:
For Google Cloud Storage (GCS), mount options are the options supported by the gcsfuse tool (https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/gcsfuse).

For existing persistent disks, mount options provided by the mount command (https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man8/mount.8.html) except writing are supported. This is due to restrictions of multi-writer mode (https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/sharing-disks-between-vms). For other attached disks and Network File System (NFS), mount options are these supported by the mount command (https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man8/mount.8.html).

Generated from protobuf field repeated string mount_options = 5;

For other attached disks and Network File System (NFS), mount options are these supported by the mount command (https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man8/mount.8.html).
